verses.verse: So Aaron returned to Moses at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, for the plague had stopped.
(The Budding of Aaron’s Rod) And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
“Speak to the children of Israel, and get from them a rod from each father’s house, all their leaders according to their fathers’ houses—twelve rods. Write each man’s name on his rod.
And you shall write Aaron’s name on the rod of Levi. For there shall be one rod for the head of each father’s house.
Then you shall place them in the tabernacle of meeting before (Ex. 25:16) the Testimony, (Ex. 25:22; 29:42, 43; 30:36; Num. 17:7) where I meet with you.
And it shall be that the rod of the man (Num. 16:5) whom I choose will blossom; thus I will rid Myself of the complaints of the children of Israel, (Num. 16:11) which they make against you.”
So Moses spoke to the children of Israel, and each of their leaders gave him a rod apiece, for each leader according to their fathers’ houses, twelve rods; and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
And Moses placed the rods before the LORD in (Ex. 38:21; Num. 1:50, 51; 9:15; 18:2; Acts 7:44) the tabernacle of witness.

Now it came to pass on the next day that Moses went into the tabernacle of witness, and behold, the ((Ezek. 17:24); Heb. 9:4) rod of Aaron, of the house of Levi, had sprouted and put forth buds, had produced blossoms and yielded ripe almonds.
Then Moses brought out all the rods from before the LORD to all the children of Israel; and they looked, and each man took his rod.

And the LORD said to Moses, “Bring (Heb. 9:4) Aaron’s rod back before the Testimony, to be kept (Num. 16:38; Deut. 9:7, 24) as a sign against the rebels, (Num. 17:5) that you may put their complaints away from Me, lest they die.”
Thus did Moses; just as the LORD had commanded him, so he did.
So the children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Surely we die, we perish, we all perish!
(Num. 1:51, 53; 18:4, 7) Whoever even comes near the tabernacle of the LORD must die. Shall we all utterly die?”

(Duties of Priests and Levites) Then the LORD said to Aaron: (Num. 17:13) “You and your sons and your father’s house with you shall (Ex. 28:38; Lev. 10:17; 22:16) bear the iniquity related to the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity associated with your priesthood.

Also bring with you your brethren of the (Gen. 29:34; Num. 1:47) tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, that they may be (Num. 3:5-10) joined with you and serve you while you and your sons are with you before the tabernacle of witness.

They shall attend to your needs and (Num. 3:25, 31, 36) all the needs of the tabernacle; (Num. 16:40) but they shall not come near the articles of the sanctuary and the altar, (Num. 4:15) lest they die—they and you also.
They shall be joined with you and attend to the needs of the tabernacle of meeting, for all the work of the tabernacle; (Num. 3:10) but an outsider shall not come near you.
And you shall attend to the duties of the sanctuary and (Ex. 27:21; 30:7; Lev. 24:3) the duties of the altar, (Num. 8:19; 16:46) that there may be no more wrath on the children of Israel.

Behold, I Myself have (Num. 3:12, 45) taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel; (Num. 3:9) they are a gift to you, given by the LORD, to do the work of the tabernacle of meeting.

Therefore (Num. 3:10; 18:5) you and your sons with you shall attend to your priesthood for everything at the altar and (Heb. 9:3, 6) behind the veil; and you shall serve. I give your priesthood to you as a (Matt. 10:8; 1 Pet. 5:2, 3) gift for service, but the outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”

(Offerings for Support of the Priests) And the LORD spoke to Aaron: “Here, (Lev. 6:16, 18; 7:28-34; Num. 5:9) I Myself have also given you charge of My heave offerings, all the holy gifts of the children of Israel; I have given them (Ex. 29:29; 40:13, 15) as a portion to you and your sons, as an ordinance forever.

This shall be yours of the most holy things reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, every (Lev. 2:2, 3; 10:12, 13) grain offering and every (Lev. 6:25, 26) sin offering and every (Lev. 7:7; Num. 5:8-10) trespass offering which they render to Me, shall be most holy for you and your sons.
(Lev. 6:16, 26) In a most holy place you shall eat it; every male shall eat it. It shall be holy to you.

“This also is yours: (Ex. 29:27, 28; Deut. 18:3-5) the heave offering of their gift, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel; I have given them to you, and your sons and daughters with you, as an ordinance forever. (Lev. 22:1-16) Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
(Ex. 23:19; Neh. 10:35, 36) “All the best of the oil, all the best of the new wine and the grain, (Ex. 22:29; Lev. 23:20) their firstfruits which they offer to the LORD, I have given them to you.
Whatever first ripe fruit is in their land, (Ex. 22:29; 23:19; 34:26) which they bring to the LORD, shall be yours. Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
(Lev. 27:1-33) “Every devoted thing in Israel shall be yours.

“Everything that first opens (Ex. 13:2) the womb of all flesh, which they bring to the LORD, whether man or beast, shall be yours; nevertheless the firstborn of man you shall surely redeem, and (Ex. 13:12-15; Num. 3:46; Luke 2:22-24) the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.

And those redeemed of the devoted things you shall redeem when one month old, (Lev. 27:6) according to your valuation, for five shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is (Ex. 30:13) twenty gerahs.

(Deut. 15:19) But the firstborn of a cow, the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat you shall not redeem; they are holy. (Lev. 3:2, 5) You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar, and burn their fat as an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma to the LORD.
And their flesh shall be yours, just as the (Ex. 29:26-28; Lev. 7:31-36) wave breast and the right thigh are yours.
